intro: Diphasium flabelliforme, commonly known as the fan-leaf diphasium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into several lobes resembling a fan. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central column. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats.
